meanings.sent1: I had to reschedule my dentist appointment for next week.
meanings.sent2: Let's reschedule our meeting for tomorrow afternoon.
meanings.sent3: I had to reschedule my cat's grooming appointment because he was napping.
meanings.sent4: The rain forced us to reschedule the picnic for another day.
meanings.sent5: She had to reschedule her flight due to a sudden change in plans.

meanings.definition: To set a new time for something
meanings.sent1: They decided to reschedule the movie night for Saturday.
meanings.sent2: Can we reschedule the conference call for later this week?
meanings.sent3: The chef had to reschedule the baking class because the oven broke.
meanings.sent4: The team had to reschedule the game due to bad weather.
meanings.sent5: He had to reschedule his doctor's appointment to accommodate his work schedule.
